title: [Suggestion (GD)] Please Put thread replies out of the thread navigation
body:
What i mean by this is that if i navigate from page 1 to page 2, that my post won't be lost.

Sometimes when i'm posting a particularly long message (especially with lots of quotes) i need to constantly go back pages to reread posts or to grab posts. However the current boards *do not allow you to open other thread pages in another page*, rather the page number navigation doesn't allow you to interact.

It becomes difficult to make a post that takes everything into account if it's difficult to go back and read pages that i can't see at the time that i'm posting. If the post was at least separated from page navigation, then i could go back to page 1 or 2 or 3 without losing my post.

I'm not sure if this could apply to the other boards as well, but in particular this is a request for GD.

replies.body: Thanks for bringing this up. It sounds like a pretty valid request so I've gone ahead and added it to our list.

And um

Can the pages be clickable instead of 'javascript'? So that we can just ctrl+click (or rmb) and open other pages in new tabs? ._."

I'm not entirely sure what you mean...but i *think* one comment quoting/replying to multiple people.

If each comment only replies to one person, then it leads to double posting, which is typically bad etiquette on forums.

Took a while for me to figure out what you meant, but I generally agree.

Question for you: Do you think the paradigm should be, "One comment, quoting/replying to multiple people," or "One comment replies to one person"?
